blog.name: yumeka36
blog.title: Yume Dimension
blog.description: Tumblr extension of my main blog, Yume Dimension, where I post pictures and ramble about Disney, Pokemon, and other animated movies, shows, video games, etc., that I like

summary: Thoughts on the new Pokemon movie, The Power of Us
title: Thoughts on the new Pokemon movie, The Power of Us
body:
The 21st Pokemon movie was shown in select theaters for a few days this past week and I finally got a chance to see it. I had heard a lot of good things about this one: it’s the first Pokemon movie in years to use all the original Japanese music, it’s the very first to have a new director, and story-wise it’s quite different than most of the others, being very character-driven. Before the movie started, we even got to see a short segment featuring an interview with the director of the previous twenty Pokemon movies, Kunihiko Yuyama. It was interesting hearing about how he got started working on the Pokemon anime and he even got to visit the set of the upcoming Detective Pikachu movie. As someone who has seen all twenty other Pokemon movies, most of them during their theatrical releases in the US if they had any, I have to say that this was the first time I felt like a Pokemon movie was being treated as an anime production and not a kids movie.

And after having seen the movie, yes, I have to say that it is definitely one of the best anime installments the franchise has delivered in years. After years and years of Pokemon movies following a very formulaic structure, it was so nice to focus on new AND interesting, compelling characters. It still had elements of the cliched Pokemon movie trope of “Ash and friends teaming up to save a legendary pokemon” but that plot definitely took a backseat in favor of the story arcs of the new characters. Despite having so many main characters and thus so many storylines going on at once, the movie did an excellent job giving ample time to each and tying everything together. For the first time in years I felt like the new characters in a Pokemon movie were defined by their own personalities and relationships with others rather than as plot devices to further a singular story. I hardly remember anything about the characters that were in the past several Pokemon movies but I’ll definitely remember these guys. There were a few holes in the movie here and there, but for the most part it was a joy for this Pokemon fan to see.

Maybe it’s the new director. Maybe it’s the fact that after 20 years the Pokemon creators are finally trying something new on the anime side of the franchise and making material that will appeal to older fans. Installments like this movie and the previous movie, and other anime specials like Pokemon Generations and Pokemon Origins that came out in the past few years, may be proof of this. As I’ve written before in a previous post of mine, the Pokemon anime may finally be getting some much needed evolution (pardon the pun) and I can’t wait to see what the next movie will be. When your fictional universe has over 800 characters that each have unique habits and origins and myriads of ways they can interact with other characters, the possibilities for good stories are endless.

*Crossposted from my main blog, Yume Dimension*

summary: Venonat have enormousness eyes that are highly adapted for nighttime hunting. Because Venonat have no eyelids to protect their...
body: Venonat have enormousness eyes that are highly adapted for nighttime hunting. Because Venonat have no eyelids to protect their eyes, they go blind when the sun goes up. They head to their dens where they recover by the next night.

reblog.comment: Venonat have enormousness eyes that are highly adapted for nighttime hunting. Because Venonat have no eyelids to protect their eyes, they go blind when the sun goes up. They head to their dens where they recover by the next night.

summary:
Fun Fact: I name all my Spindas after their spot patterns. 
Reverse Africa (Main spot looks vaguely like Africa, but...
body:
Fun Fact: I name all my Spindas after their spot patterns.

Reverse Africa (Main spot looks vaguely like Africa, but reversed)

Rosy Cheeks (Two big spots, one on each cheek)

Birthmark (Just looks like a random birthmark on it’s face)

Goatee (Has an Evil Genius-Style Goatee)

I am currently dubbing the new Spinda “Skellington” (Name a work in progress), I think because the spots fall exactly on the eyes, like Jack Skellington’s skull.

Patreon

My patreon is now all set up! I’ll be posting Some art stuff there in a bit!

I’ll be posting mostly fandom stuff that I dont usually post anywhere!

Here are some fandoms I draw a lot:

Undertale

Five Night’s At Freddy’s

Poke'mon

Naruto

MLP

Steven universe

For just 2$ a month you can get access to all of my art, and a free sketch for almost any fandom!*

Money goes towards buying new supplies and art stuff so I can experiment with new mediums and offer new art rewards!

You can find me here!

https://www.patreon.com/Manitka

summary: ;________; I honestly think this is my favourite catching scene in the whole series now. I cried, as silly as it sounds. It was...
caption:
;________;

I honestly think this is my favourite catching scene in the whole series now. I cried, as silly as it sounds. It was so well crafted. So well done. Suiren’s friends encouraging her, she realising they have lots in common. God. Suiren and Nagisa were made for each other! Also, after Suiren announces the name Nagisa:

Kaki asjfhgsjhfgsjhfgsjhgfjh.

I love how Mao’s like oh Suiren pls.

And Satoshi so excited ah!!!!

Anyway. Suiren now has another Pokemon on her roster, and gosh, they all fit together so well! I can’t wait to see what the future holds for these three, as in Suiren, Ashimari and Nagisa the Eevee!

Congratulations on getting a new friend Suiren! ♥
